page.title: 11STUDLAND NATURE RESERVE
page.content: Studland National Nature Reserve consists of an area of{heathland, {woodland,marsh,sand dunes and beach } to the North of Studland village.The Reserve,1560 acres,was set up in 1947 to protect the environment. Four hundred years ago the first seamen's charts showed that the sandunes were shifting eastwards. {Little Sea}(A fresh water lake) was formed in this way,but other smaller ponds were created by bombs exploding in the war. A full time warden,with help from 2 estate workers,looks after the reserve which is open to the public.{Nature {trails}are marked out,a{Bird Hide}is positioned by a lake and booklets on local wildlife are available.School parties can be catered for.
